name: Cuba
description: Cuba, an island nation in the Caribbean Sea, boasts a rich history, vibrant culture, and stunning natural beauty. From the turquoise waters of the Caribbean to the rugged peaks of the Sierra Maestra mountains, Cuba offers a diverse range of landscapes and experiences. The country’s unique blend of Spanish, African, and indigenous influences is reflected in its music, art, and cuisine.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The historic capital of Cuba, a UNESCO World Heritage site.
quickFacts.detail: Havana is renowned for its colonial architecture, vibrant nightlife, and rich cultural heritage.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Cuba's population is a diverse mix of ethnicities.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population resides in urban areas, particularly Havana and Santiago de Cuba.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Cuba is the largest island in the Caribbean.
quickFacts.detail: It is geographically diverse, encompassing plains, mountains, and coastal regions.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Spanish is the official language of Cuba.
quickFacts.detail: However, Cuban Creole (Cuban Spanish) is widely spoken and has unique characteristics.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: The economy is undergoing significant changes, and access to foreign currency can be challenging.

quickFacts.label: Independence
quickFacts.description: Cuba gained independence from Spain in 1898.
quickFacts.detail: This event marked a pivotal moment in Cuban history and shaped the nation's identity.

climateData.title: Tropical Climate
climateData.description: Cuba experiences a tropical climate with consistent warmth and humidity throughout the year. The country is influenced by trade winds and the warm Caribbean Current.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summer is hot and humid, with frequent afternoon showers.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn brings a gradual decrease in humidity and rainfall.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter is the dry season, with sunny skies and comfortable temperatures.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings a return of humidity and increased rainfall.

naturalWonders.name: Sian Ka'an Biosphere Reserve
naturalWonders.description: A vast, protected area encompassing mangrove forests, lagoons, and coral reefs along the Yucatan Peninsula's Caribbean coast. It's a crucial habitat for diverse wildlife and a vital part of the Mesoamerican Barrier Reef System.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Sian Ka'an is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a biodiversity hotspot. Its intricate network of waterways provides refuge for numerous species of birds, marine life, and terrestrial animals. The reserve offers opportunities for eco-tourism, research, and conservation.
viewingTips: Wear lightweight clothing and insect repellent

scientificData.Biodiversity: Over 700 species of plants and animals

naturalWonders.name: Escambray Mountains (Sierra Maestra)
naturalWonders.description: A rugged mountain range in central Cuba, known for its dense forests, waterfalls, and rich biodiversity. It played a significant role in the Cuban Revolution.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The Escambray Mountains are a haven for endemic species and offer challenging hiking trails. The region's isolation has preserved its pristine natural beauty and provides a glimpse into Cuba's pre-Columbian past.  The mountains are home to diverse flora and fauna, including jaguars, Cuban toads, and numerous bird species.
bestLocations: Santuario de la Virgen de la Cueva

naturalWonders.name: Cienfuegos Bay
naturalWonders.description: A stunning bay on Cuba's southern coast, renowned for its turquoise waters, white-sand beaches, and lush vegetation.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Cienfuegos Bay is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a popular destination for tourists and locals alike. The bay is home to a diverse array of marine life, including dolphins, manatees, and colorful fish. The surrounding area is dotted with charming colonial towns and historic plantations.
viewingTips: Take a boat tour to explore the bay
Snorkel or dive in the clear waters

scientificData.Coral Reefs: Extensive coral reefs support diverse marine life

ecosystemData.title: Cuban Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Cuba’s ecosystems are remarkably diverse, ranging from tropical rainforests and wetlands to dry scrublands and coastal environments. These ecosystems support a rich array of plant and animal life, many of which are endemic to the island.

biodiversityCategories.name: Endemic Flora
biodiversityCategories.description: Cuba is home to a significant number of plant species found nowhere else in the world.

statistics.details: Approximately 20% of Cuba's plant species are endemic.
Many plants have traditional medicinal uses.

notableSpecies.name: Durleya cubensis
notableSpecies.significance: A rare succulent plant found only in Cuba.

notableSpecies.name: Pitcairnia cubensis
notableSpecies.significance: A unique palm species endemic to Cuba.

biodiversityCategories.name: Endemic Fauna
biodiversityCategories.description: Cuba boasts a unique array of animal species, including several endemic reptiles and birds.

statistics.details: Several lizard and snake species are found only in Cuba.

notableSpecies.name: Cuban Trogon
notableSpecies.significance: A brightly colored trogon endemic to Cuba.

notableSpecies.name: Hispaniolan Hutia
notableSpecies.significance: A small rodent found only in Cuba.

activities.title: Cuban Adventures
activities.description: Cuba offers a wide range of activities for travelers of all interests and abilities.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Cuba's diverse landscapes on foot.

activities.name: Sierra Maestra Trek
activities.description: A challenging trek through the heart of the Sierra Maestra mountains.
activities.requirements: Good physical fitness, hiking boots, water bottle

activities.name: Viñales Valley Hike
activities.description: Hike through the stunning landscapes of the Viñales Valley, known for its mogotes (limestone hills).

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the crystal-clear waters of the Caribbean Sea.

activities.name: Scuba Diving in Cienfuegos Bay
activities.description: Explore the vibrant coral reefs and marine life of Cienfuegos Bay.

activities.name: Kayaking in Bacalar Lagoon
activities.description: Paddle through the stunning turquoise waters of Bacalar Lagoon.

clothing.winter: Layers of clothing, sweater, jacket, rain gear

equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, backpack, water bottle, map
